revised_title: Critical Properties of Electron Eigenstates in Incommensurate Systems: A Renormalization Group Approach
tldr: This article explores the properties of electron eigenstates in incommensurate systems, focusing on the critical points and localization transitions. The authors use a renormalization group method to analyze the eigenvalue equation and provide a physical interpretation of Azbel's result. The study has implications for understanding electron behavior in one-dimensional solids with incommensurate structures and in models for energy bands of Bloch electrons in a magnetic field.
